author: Ray A. Smith
title: A History of Gaffes at the Oscars - WSJ
text:
Film A History of Gaffes at the Oscars From a streaker in 1974 to John Travolta’s mispronunciation of Idina Menzel’s name, some high-profile indiscretions from past Academy Awards By @rayalexsmith Updated Feb. 27, 2017 3:57 p.m. ET 
The Oscars, the biggest and one of the most highly choreographed live award shows, experienced its biggest gaffe in history last night. Here are a few other moments when things veered off-script and made jaws drop: 
1964: Sammy Davis Jr. announced John Addison as the winner of the best score award for his work on “Tom Jones.” But the music from “Tom Jones” wasn’t even nominated in that category. Mr. Davis had been given the wrong... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
